row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: AEA/ASSA meetings, federal recovery programs, online services

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 2.2 percent after decreasing 0.7 percent in the second quarter. Consumer spending, exports, inventory investment, and residential investment turned up. Corporate profits picked up.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the Third Quarter of 2009
row.Description: These statistics, including those on inventories for manufacturing by stage of fabrication, have been updated.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions for the Third Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Douglas B. Weinberg
row.Description: The U.S. current-account deficit increased $10.1 billion to $108.0 billion. The deficit on goods increased. In the financial account, net financial inflows decreased $25.0 billion to $38.3 billion.
row.Supp2_Title: Allocations of Special Drawing Rights in the ITAs

row.Title: An Ownership-Based Framework of the U.S. Current Account for 1999â€“2008
row.Author: Jeffrey H. Lowe
row.Description: This annual supplement to the international accounts presents current-account statistics that combine cross-border trade and net receipts of affiliates of multinational companies.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: Tina C. Highfill, David G. Lenze, Mauricio Ortiz
row.Description: State personal income grew in 41 states in the third quarter of 2009, and compensation grew in more than 80 percent of the nation's 3,112 counties in 2008.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: NIPA handbook, congressional info portal

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 5.7 percent after increasing 2.2 percent in the third quarter. Inventory investment accelerated, imports decelerated, and business investment turned up. In 2009, real GDP decreased 2.4 percent.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Economic Measurement in Turbulent Times
row.Description: Four perspectives on the November 2009 conference "Measuring Innovation and Change During Turbulent Economic Times," sponsored by the Brookings Institution and The Heritage Foundation.
row.Supp1_Title: How Should We Think About Measuring Innovation and Change?
row.Supp2_Title: Data for an Evolving Economic and Financial System
row.Supp4_Title: Designing a New Architecture for the U.S. National Accounts to Capture Innovation

row.Title: Experimental Quarterly U.S. GDP by Industry Statistics
row.Author: Carol A. Robbins, Thomas F. Howells, Wendy Li
row.Description: An overview of BEA's efforts to publish GDP by industry statistics quarterly and the methodology behind the proposed statistics.

row.Title: A Guide to the U.S. International Transactions Accounts and the U.S. International Investment Position Accounts
row.Author: Christopher L. Bach
row.Description: A guide to these international economic accounts, which have long provided important statistical information for economists and policymakers.

row.Title: John W. Kendrick: An Appreciation
row.Author: Arnold J. Katz, Bruce T. Grimm

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Vertical specialization trade

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 5.9 percent after increasing 2.2 percent in the third quarter. Inventory investment accelerated, imports decelerated, and business investment turned up. Consumer spending and federal government spending decelerated.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: NIPA Translation of the Fiscal Year 2011 Federal Budget
row.Author: Mark S. Ludwick, Andrew P. Cairns
row.Description: Every year, BEA prepares federal government estimates based on the proposed budget of the U.S. government. This analysis is often used to gauge the effects of the federal budget on U.S. economic activity.
row.Category: National, NIPA translation of the federal budget

row.Title: Preview of the Comprehensive Revision of the Annual Industry Accounts: Changes in Definitions, Classification, and Statistical Methods
row.Author: Nicole M. Mayerhauser, Erich H. Strassner
row.Description: The 2010 comprehensive revision of the annual industry accounts incorporates a wide array of improvements to better reflect the evolving economy.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Travel spending, Haiti earthquake, Web features

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 5.6 percent after increasing 2.2 percent in the third quarter. Inventory investment accelerated, imports decelerated, and business investment turned up. Consumer spending and federal government spending slowed.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures, Fourth Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Natalie M. Hayes
row.Description: Net government saving increased $60.8 billion to â€“$1,307.7 billion. Net federal government saving increased $46.4 billion to â€“$1,307.2 billion. Net state and local government saving increased $14.4 billion to â€“$0.5 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the Fourth Quarter of 2009
row.Description: These statistics, including those for inventories for manufacturing by stage of fabrication, have been updated.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: GDP and Beyond: Measuring Economic Progress and Sustainability
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld, Brent R. Moulton, Joel D. Platt, Shaunda M. Villones
row.Description: BEA has proposed measures to supplement the GDP accounts that would give economists additional tools to analyze the distribution of income across households, sectors, and regions as well as trends in saving, investment, and asset prices.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions for the Fourth Quarter and Year 2009
row.Author: Douglas B. Weinberg, Erin M. Whitaker
row.Description: The U.S. current-account deficit increased $13.2 billion to $115.6 billion, reflecting an increase in the deficit on goods. In the financial account, net financial inflows decreased $40.0 billion to $45.7 billion. In 2009, the current-account deficit decreased to $419.9 billion, the smallest deficit since 2001.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: Nacola A. Alexander, Michelle A. Harder, Carrie L. Litkowski, Matthew A. vonKerczek, Mauricio Ortiz
row.Description: State personal income for the nation decreased 1.7 percent in 2009. Personal income increased in only six states. Nationally, per capita personal income fell 2.6 percent after increasing 2.0 percent in 2008.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: MNC activity, statistics on federal recovery programs

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the First Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 3.2 percent after increasing 5.6 percent in the fourth quarter. Inventory investment and exports slowed, and residential investment turned down. Consumer spending picked up.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Modernizing and Enhancing BEA's International Economic Accounts: Recent Progress and Future Directions
row.Author: Kristy L. Howell, Robert E. Yuskavage
row.Description: BEA is considering changes to better align its international accounts with updated guidelines from the International Monetary Fund and the Organisation of Economic Co-operation and Development.
row.Category: BEA Briefing, International, Modernizing and enhancing BEA's international economic accounts

row.Title: Comprehensive Revision of Local Area Personal Income: New Statistics for 2008 and Revised Statistics for 1969â€“2007
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: Personal income growth slowed in more than two-thirds of the 3,112 counties in the nation in 2008. These revised statistics reflect the 2009 comprehensive revisions of the national income and product accounts and the state personal income accounts.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Trade-weighted import costs

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the First Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 3.0 percent after increasing 5.6 percent in the fourth quarter of 2009. Inventory investment and exports slowed, and residential investment turned down. Consumer spending picked up. Corporate profits increased $81.4 billion after increasing $108.7 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: First Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Natalie M. Hayes
row.Description: Net government saving decreased $20.3 billion to â€“$1,335.1 billion. Net federal government saving decreased $38.2 billion to â€“$1,352.5 billion. Net state and local government saving increased $17.8 billion to $17.3 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Annual Industry Accounts: Advance Statistics on GDP by Industry for 2009 and Revised Statistics for 1998â€“2008, Comprehensive Revision
row.Author: Matthew M. Donahoe, Edward T. Morgan, Kevin J. Muck, Ricky L. Stewart
row.Description: In 2009, 15 of 22 industry groups contributed to the 2.4 percent decline in real gross domestic product. Revised estimates for 1998â€“2008 confirm previously identified trends, such as the economic slowdown of 2008.

row.Title: Measuring Human Capital
row.Description: Four perspectives from the May 7, 2010, BEA Advisory Committee Meeting.
row.Supp1_Title: Human Capital Accounting in the United States, 1994â€“2006
row.Supp2_Title: Comment on Human Capital Accounting in the United States
row.Supp3_Title: Accounting for Investments in Formal Education
row.Supp4_Title: Human Capital and the National Accounts

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Integrated macroeconomic account data

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the First Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 2.7 percent after increasing 5.6 percent in the fourth quarter of 2009. Inventory investment and exports slowed, and residential investment turned down. Consumer spending picked up. Corporate profits increased $116.9 billion after increasing $108.7 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the First Quarter of 2010
row.Description: These statistics, including those for inventories for manufacturing by stage of fabrication, have been updated.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: The International Investment Position of the United States at Yearend 2009
row.Author: Elena L. Nguyen
row.Description: The net international investment position was â€“$2,737.8 billion; in 2008, it was â€“$3.493.9 billion. U.S.-owned assets abroad decreased $865.8 billion to $18,379.1 billion, and foreign-owned assets in the United States increased $1,621.8 billion to $21,116.9 billion.

row.Title: Direct Investment Positions for 2009: Country and Industry Detail
row.Author: Marilyn Ibarra-Caton
row.Description: The U.S. direct investment abroad position grew 9 percent after growing 8 percent in 2008. The foreign direct investment in the United States position grew 7 percent after growing 5 percent.

row.Title: Annual Revision of the U.S. International Transactions Accounts
row.Author: Helen Y. Bai, Mai-Chi Hoang
row.Description: Each year, statistics on U.S. international transactions are revised to incorporate revised data and statistical improvements. Several significant changes were introduced this year in order to align the accounts with updated international guidelines.

row.Title: How BEA Aligns and Augments Source Data From the U.S. Treasury Department for Inclusion in the U.S. International Transactions Accounts
row.Description: Each year, the estimates of financial-account flows in these accounts, which are based on Treasury Department data, are adjusted to align the estimates with balance-of-payments concepts and to close the gaps in coverage.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: First Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Sarah Scott Thomas, Erin M. Whitaker, Daniel R. Yorgason
row.Description: The U.S. current-account deficit increased $8.1 billion to $109.0 billion. In the financial account, net financial inflows decreased $84.5 billion to $31.3 billion.

row.Title: International Transactions and Positions in Financial Derivatives
row.Description: Statistics on transactions in financial derivatives by type of contract and by area and country for 2007â€“2009. Statistics on the fair values of these derivatives for 2008â€“2009.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: State personal income grew in all but two states in the first quarter of 2010. For 20 states, including California and Florida, net earnings grew at the fastest pace since the recession began in the fourth quarter of 2007.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Health care data sets

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 2.4 percent after increasing 3.7 percent in the first quarter. Imports picked up. Inventory investment and consumer spending slowed.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Annual Revision of the National Income and Product Accounts: Annual Estimates for 2007â€“2009 and Quarterly Estimates for the First Quarter of 2007 to the First Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Eugene P. Seskin, Shelly Smith
row.Description: Annual revisions update the accounts by incorporating new data and methodology improvements. This annual revision did not alter the direction of real GDP growth for any quarter. From 2006 to 2009, real GDP decreased at an average annual rate of 0.2 percent.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: National Income and Product Accounts Tables
row.Description: Annual, quarterly, and monthly statistics from the annual NIPA revision, including advance estimates for the second quarter of 2010 and for June 2010.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: GDP and Other Major NIPA Series for 1929â€“the Second Quarter of 2010
row.Description: Historical statistics of GDP and its components in current dollars, chained dollars, and chain-type quantity and price indexes, including statistics on national income and personal income.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Returns for Domestic Nonfinancial Business
row.Author: Andrew W. Hodge, Robert J. Corea
row.Description: Aggregate rates of return for nonfinancial corporations, industries, and selected industry groups and various Q ratios. Domestic nonfinancial corporate returns fell in 2009 for the third consecutive year.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: U.S. Multinational Companies: Operations in the United States and Abroad in 2008
row.Author: Kevin B. Barefoot, Raymond J. Mataloni Jr.
row.Description: The value added of U.S. multinational companies decreased 1.8 percent. The value added of U.S. parents decreased 6.5 percent, and the value added of their foreign affiliates increased 9.1 percent. Worldwide employment of U.S. multinational companies decreased 0.5 percent.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Industry data updates, fellowship program

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 1.6 percent after increasing 3.7 percent in the first quarter. Imports picked up, and inventory investment slowed. But consumer spending picked up.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: Second Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Natalie M. Hayes
row.Description: Net government saving decreased $18.4 billion to â€“$1,304.1 billion. Net federal government saving decreased $11.1 billion to â€“$1,325.3 billion. Net state and local government saving decreased $7.4 billion to $21.2 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Newly Available NIPA Tables
row.Description: Statistics on government spending by function, changes in the net stock of fixed assets, and a comparison of NIPA and USDA net farm income. All reflect the 2010 annual NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Fixed Assets and Consumer Durable Goods for 2000â€“2009
row.Author: David B. Wasshausen, Jennifer A. Bennett, Debasis Chaudhuri, Michael T. Cusick, Michael D. Glenn, Christopher B. Mbu, Nadia F.P. SadÃ©e
row.Description: Statistics on the net stock of (1) equipment and software and of business and government structures and (2) consumer durable goods. Both reflect the 2010 annual NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, Fixed assets and consumer durable goods

row.Title: GDP for American Samoa, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, and the U.S. Virgin Islands for 2002â€“2007
row.Author: Aya Hamano, Nicole M. Mayerhauser, Clinton P. McCully, Carol E. Moylan, Marc Rubin
row.Description: According to new estimates, real GDP over this period increased in American Samoa (annual rate of 0.4 percent), Guam (1.8 percent) and the U.S. Virgin Islands (2.9 percent). In the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, real GDP declined at a rate of 4.2 percent.

row.Title: A Reconciliation of Health Care Expenditures in the Nation Health Expenditures Accounts and in Gross Domestic Product
row.Author: Micah B. Hartman, Robert J. Kornfeld, Aaron C. Catlin
row.Description: A comparison of two widely followed sets of health care expenditure statistics, identifying and quantifying the similarities and differences.

row.Title: Direct Investment for 2007â€“2009: Detailed Historical-Cost Positions and Related Financial and Income Flows
row.Author: Jeffrey H. Lowe
row.Description: Statistics on (1) the direct investment positions and international transactions of U.S. and foreign multinational companies and (2) the composition of investment by U.S. companies abroad and foreign companies in the United States.
row.Supp2_Title: Foreign Direct Investment in the United States Tables

row.Title: Personal Income for Metropolitan Areas for 2009
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: Personal income decreased in 223 of the nation's 366 metropolitan areas. It increased in 134 areas, and it was unchanged in 9 areas.
row.Category: Regional, Personal income for metropolitan areas

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: NIPA handbook, FAQs

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 1.7 percent after increasing 3.7 percent in the first quarter. Imports picked up. Inventory investment slowed, but consumer spending picked up.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Newly Available NIPA Tables
row.Description: Statistics on federal receipts and expenditures and the budget, state and local receipts and expenditures and Census Bureau data, state government and local government receipts and expenditures, and seasonally unadjusted estimates. All reflect the 2010 annual NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Alternative Measures of Personal Saving
row.Author: Janet H. Kmitch
row.Description: BEA publishes a variety of alternative measures of saving roughly every other year to complement the widely watched NIPA measure of personal saving.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the Fourth Quarter of 2006 to the Second Quarter of 2010
row.Description: Updated statistics, including statistics on inventories for manufacturing by stage of fabrication. All reflect the 2010 annual NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: U.S. International Services: Cross-Border Trade in 2009 and Services Supplied Through Affiliates in 2008
row.Author: Jennifer Koncz-Bruner, Anne Flatness
row.Description: A look at international services provided to and by the United States in two channels: cross-border trade and services supplied through affiliates.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions for the Second Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Sarah Scott Thomas, Erin M. Whitaker
row.Description: The U.S. current-account deficit increased $14.1 billion to $123.3 billion. In the financial account, net financial inflows increased $1.9 billion to $36.6 billion.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze, Tina C. Highfill
row.Description: State personal income growth ranged from 2.0 percent in North Dakota to 0.3 percent in Nevada in the second quarter of 2010. In 27 states, personal income has climbed above the current-dollar level reached before the recession-induced decline.

row.Title: Schedule of BEA News Release in 2011
Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: World Statistics Day, direct investment abroad data, fellowship program

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 2.0 percent after increasing 1.7 percent in the second quarter. Imports slowed. Inventory investment and consumer spending picked up. Residential investment turned down.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)
row.Supp1_Title: Seasonal Adjustment and the Price Index for Imports of Petroleum

row.Title: Newly Available NIPA Tables
row.Description: Personal income and its disposition by households and nonprofit institutions serving households as well as a comparison of BEA and IRS statistics on income and outlays of these nonprofits.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Updated Summary of NIPA Methodologies
row.Description: The data and methods used to prepare current-dollar and real estimates of GDP and current-dollar estimates of gross domestic income, reflecting the 2010 annual NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: U.S. Travel and Tourism Satellite Accounts for 2004â€“2009
row.Author: Steven L. Zemanek, Stanislaw J. Rzeznik
row.Description: In 2009, the travel and tourism industry continued to decline, decreasing 4.7 percent after decreasing 3.1 percent in 2008. Employment also decreased.
row.Category: Industry, Travel and tourism satellite accounts

row.Title: U.S. Affiliates of Foreign Companies: Operations in 2008
row.Author: Thomas Anderson
row.Description: The current-dollar value added of these affiliates decreased 1.5 percent to $670.3 billion despite a substantial increase in foreign investment in the United States. Employment by these affiliates increased 0.1 percent.
row.Category: International, Foreign direct investment in the United States

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Effects of terms of trade

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 2.5 percent after increasing 1.7 percent in the second quarter. Imports slowed. Inventory investment and consumer spending picked up. Residential investment turned down.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: Third Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Natalie M. Hayes
row.Description: Net government saving increased $32.8 billion to â€“$1,288.0 billion. Net federal government saving decreased $1.5 billion to â€“$1,388.0 billion. Net state and local government saving increased $34.2 billion to $50.0 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Celebrating 75 Years of the National Accounts: Remarks by Secretary Locke and Acting Deputy Secretary Blank of the Department of Commerce
row.Description: On November 30, 2010, BEA jointly celebrated the 75th anniversary of the national accounts and GDP as well as outstanding performances by its employees in 2010.

row.Title: Research and Development Satellite Account Update: Estimates for 1959â€“2007
row.Author: Jennifer Lee, Andrew G. Schmidt
row.Description: This update examines the effects of R&D on economic growth. It includes statistics on R&D-intensive industries and national, regional, and international statistics.
row.Category: National, Research and development satellite account

row.Title: Reconciliation of the United States-Canadian Current Account, 2008 and 2009
row.Author: Barbara Berman, Edward Dozier, Denis Caron
row.Description: The bilateral current-account estimates of the United States and Canada are reconciled to show how the estimates would appear if both countries used the same definitions, methodologies, and data sources.

row.Title: Gross Domestic Product by State: Advance Statistics for 2009 and Revised Statistics for 1963â€“2008
row.Author: Slavea Assenova, John Broda, Shane Taylor
row.Description: Real GDP decreased in 38 states and in all eight BEA regions in 2009. The nationwide decline reflected declines in durable-goods manufacturing and construction.
row.Category: Regional, Gross domestic product by state

row.Title: Subject Guide for 2010
row.Description: A list of articles published in the Survey of Current Business in 2010.

row.Title: BEA's 2011 News Release Schedule
